contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Infobox album <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> | Name = Dressing Up the Idiot | Type = studio | Artist = [[Prunella Scales (band)|Prunella Scales]] | Cover = | Released = 1997 | Recorded = | Genre = [[Heavy metal music|Hard rock]], [[punk rock]] | Length = | Label = Mutiny Records | Producer = Rachel Bolan and Prunella Scales | Reviews = | Last album = | This album = ''Dressing Up the Idiot'' | Next album = }} '''''Dressing Up the Idiot''''' ([[1997 in music|1997]]) was the only album by the band [[Prunella Scales (band)|Prunella Scales]]. ==Track listing== # "Crisp" # "Deadman" # "Freak Machine" # "When" # "Fifty Tons of Life" # "Don't Let the Flowers Die" # "Toms River" # "TV is King" # "Had to Look" # "Talk Myself Down" ==Bonus track on WEA Japan release== # "The Hardest Part" ==Personnel== * [[Rachel Bolan]]: Bass and Vocals * [[Phil Varone]]: Drums and Vocals * [[Elwood Francis]]: Guitar and Vocals * [[Tommy Southard]]: Guitar and Vocals Tommy Southard is current founder/member of "Solace" and past member of "Godspeed". Elwood Francis is featured in the film "FUZZ: The Sound that Revolutionized the World". {{Use dmy dates|date=January 2011}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Dressing Up The Idiot}}{{Skid Row}} [[Category:1997 albums]] [[Category:Mutiny Records albums]] {{1990s-hard-rock-album-stub}}
